member.name: T:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi
member.summary: Starting point for accessing all queue related APIS This is mostly a factory for creating Queues and Transactions.
member.remarks: Exceptions are not used unless there is an exceptional condition. For example, if an items doesn't exist or a param is invalid, this is handled without an exception. This is mostly for speed and simplicity with the gRPC interface.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.#ctor(NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The storage implementation to use for storage of queues and messages.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.CreateQueue(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new queue.
member.param: The name of the queue.
member.returns: A Queue info object. Note: the queueName is the stadnardized name.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.DeleteQueue(System.String)
member.summary: Delete a queue and all messages in the queue. Throws an exception if Queue doesn't exist.
member.param: Name of the queue to delete.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.GetQueueInfoById(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns information about the requested queue.
member.param: The ID of the queue.
member.returns: QueueInfo object. Returns null if not found.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.GetQueueInfoByName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns information about the requested queue.
member.param: The Name of the queue to lookup.
member.returns: QueueInfo object. Null if not found.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.DeleteQueue(System.Int64)
member.summary: Deletes a queue and 1) rollsback any transaction related to the queue, 2) deletes all messages in the queue.
member.param: Queue id.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of storage resources.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.InitializeStorage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates underlying structure in the storage layer.
member.param: Will delete and recreate underlying structures.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.StartTrasaction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts a transaction used my add message and pull message.
member.param: Override default expiration time.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.ExtendTransaction(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Extends the transaction by x number of minutes (from the current datetime).
member.param: The transaction to extend.
How long to extend the transaction by.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.PeekMessageByQueueId(System.Int64)
member.summary: View the next message in the spcified queue.
member.remarks: Keep in mind, this may change by the time of the dequeue call.
member.param: The queue to peek from.
member.returns: Message object or null if no message available.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.PeekMessageById(System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieve a message by it's message ID.
member.remarks: Keep in mind, this may change by the time of the dequeue call.
member.param: The ID of the message to retrieve.
member.returns: Message object or null if no message available.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.CommitTransaction(System.Int64)
member.summary: Commits Transaction, updating all messages in transaction.
member.param: Transaction Id to commit.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.RollbackTransaction(System.Int64)
member.summary: Rollsback a transaction, undoing any changes to messages in the transaction.
member.param: The transaction ID of the transaction to rollback.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.QueueMessage(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Byte[],System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a message to the specified queue.
member.param: The transaction to add the message in.
The queue the message will be placed in.
The message payload.
Message metadata.
The message priority. Higher numbers will have higher priority.
How many times should the message pull fail before being retired.
How long in minutes before the message will expire before it's pulled. 0 = no expiration.
Correlation number.
Group name applied to message.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.DequeueMessage(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Dequeues a message from a specific queue.
member.param: The transaction ID of the transaction the message will be dequeued in.
The queue to pull the messge from.
member.returns: Returns a message object or null if there is no message to dequeue.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.InternalApi.PerformTransactionHouseCleaning(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Expires transactions, message and checks message counts, maybe.
member.param: The current time is passed in so it is consistent with the time used in the calling procedure.

member.name: T:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage
member.summary: The interface for storing and retrieving queue information from a storage mechinism, usually a database. When implementing IStorage, use the StorageSqlite as an example. There should be no business logic in classes that implement IStorage.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.InitializeStorage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when Queue process starts. Connections to the storage should be made here, etc.
member.param: Should all existing queues and messages be deleted.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.AddQueue(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new Queue in storage.
member.param: Queue name.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.DeleteQueue(System.Int64)
member.summary: Delete a Queue and ALL messages in the Queue.
member.param: Queue Id of the queue to delete.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.GetTransactionById(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a Transaction object or null value if not found.
member.param: The Id of the transaction to lookup.
member.returns: Transaction object or null if not found.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.AddMessage(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Byte[],System.DateTime,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Int32,System.String,NWorkQueue.Common.TransactionAction,NWorkQueue.Common.MessageState)
member.summary: Add a message to the storage.
member.param: Queue Transaction ID.
ID of the storage queue.
Message data.
Datetime the message was added.
String metadata on message data.
Message priority.
How many retries before expires.
Datetime the message will expire.
Correlation ID.
Group name.
Always will be "add".
"Always will be in transaction.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.GetQueueInfoByName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the id and name of the Queue. If no queue is found, returns null.
member.remarks: This search should be case sensitive, only use LIKE with SQLite.
member.param: Name of the queue to lookup.
member.returns: QueueInfo containing ID and Name of queue. Null if not found.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.GetQueueInfoById(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the id and name of the Queue. If no queue is found, returns null.
member.remarks: This search should be case sensitive, only use LIKE with SQLite.
member.param: ID of the queue to lookup.
member.returns: QueueInfo containing ID and Name of queue. Null if not found.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.StartTransaction(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Starts a transaction for use when adding or pulling messages.
member.param: When the transaction started.
When the transaction will end.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.UpdateMessages(NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction,System.Int64,NWorkQueue.Common.TransactionAction,NWorkQueue.Common.MessageState,NWorkQueue.Common.MessageState,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Updates a set of messages.
member.param: The storage transaction to make change within.
The transaction the messages are associated with.
The TransactionAction to search for.
Current message state.
Update the message state to this value.
member.returns: Returns the number of messages updated.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.UpdateMessageAttemptCount(NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction,System.Int64,NWorkQueue.Common.TransactionAction,NWorkQueue.Common.MessageState)
member.summary: Updates the message retry cuont based on transactionAction and MessageState.
member.param: The storage transaction to run the query under.
The messages must be in this transaction.
The transactionAction the message must be in.
The messageState the message must be in.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.DeleteAddedMessages(NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction,System.Int64)
member.summary: Delete messages that were added in the specified transtacion.
member.param: The storage transaction to run the query in.
The transaction the messages must be in.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.ExtendTransaction(System.Int64,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Extends the transaction's expiration datetime.
member.param: The id of the transaction to update.
The new expiration datetime.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.UpdateTransactionState(NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction,System.Int64,NWorkQueue.Common.TransactionState,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Update the transaction's state and end datetime.
member.param: The storage transaction to make change within.
The id of the transaction to update.
The new state of the transaction.
Reason the transaction was ended. Optional.
Datetime the transaction was closed (or null if not closed).

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.BeginStorageTransaction
member.summary: Starts a storage (database) transaction, not a queue transaction.
member.remarks: Not all Storage classes will have internal transactions, so this can return a dummy class that performs no actions.
member.returns: Returns a class represented by IStorageTransaction which can commit or rollbacl the transaction.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.DeleteAddedMessagesInExpiredTrans(NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Deletes added messages in an expired transaction.
member.param: Storage Transaction to run under.
DateTime to expire against.
member.returns: Returns the count of the deleted records.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.UpdateMessageAttemptsInExpiredTrans(NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Updates the retry counts for messages in an expired transaction.
member.param: Storage Transaction to run under.
DateTime to expire against.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.ExpireTransactions(NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Expires transactions whose expiry date time is past the currentDateTime.
member.param: Storage Transaction to run under.
DateTime to expire against.
member.returns: Returns the number of transactions expired.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.ExpireMessages(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Expire messages that are past their expiration date.
member.param: Date used to validate expiration date against. Also to be used as the close datetime.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.CloseMaxAttemptsExceededMessages(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Close message that are beyond their retry count.
member.param: DateTime to use a close datetime.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.DequeueMessage(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Dequeue the next message in the queue and flag the message with the transaction id.
member.param: The transaction id to add to the message.
The queue to pull the message frrom.
member.returns: Message object or null of no message to pull.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.PeekMessageByQueueId(System.Int64)
member.summary: View the next message in the queue, without removing it from queue.
member.param: The queue to pull the message from.
member.returns: Message object or null of no message to pull.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorage.PeekMessageByMessageId(System.Int64)
member.summary: View a message by the message ID.
member.param: The ID of the message to view.
member.returns: Message object or null of no message to view.

member.name: T:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction
member.summary: Represents a transaction used by the storage (usually a database transaction).

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transaction, usually this reprents a database transaction.

member.name: M:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.IStorageTransaction.Rollback
member.summary: Rollsback the transaction, usually this reprents a database transaction.

member.name: T:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.Models.QueueInfo
member.summary: Contains information a specific queue.

member.name: P:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.Models.QueueInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets queue name.

member.name: P:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.Models.QueueInfo.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets queue ID.

member.name: T:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode
member.summary: Result codes from internal API calls. This currently map directly to gRPC status codes, but the internal api may be used with another protocol, hence it can't depend on gRPC status codes. Most of these are not used by the Internal API.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.Ok
member.summary: Not an error; returned on success.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.Cancelled
member.summary: The operation was cancelled (typically by the caller).

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown error. An example of where this error may be returned is if a Status value received from another address space belongs to an error-space that is not known in this address space. Also errors raised by APIs that do not return enough error information may be converted to this error.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.InvalidArgument
member.summary: Client specified an invalid argument. Note that this differs from FAILED_PRECONDITION. INVALID_ARGUMENT indicates arguments that are problematic regardless of the state of the system (e.g., a malformed file name).

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.DeadlineExceeded
member.summary: Deadline expired before operation could complete. For operations that change the state of the system, this error may be returned even if the operation has completed successfully. For example, a successful response from a server could have been delayed long enough for the deadline to expire.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.NotFound
member.summary: Some requested entity (e.g., file or directory) was not found.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.AlreadyExists
member.summary: Some entity that we attempted to create (e.g., file or directory) already exists.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.PermissionDenied
member.summary: The caller does not have permission to execute the specified operation. PERMISSION_DENIED must not be used for rejections caused by exhausting some resource (use RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED instead for those errors). PERMISSION_DENIED must not be used if the caller can not be identified (use UNAUTHENTICATED instead for those errors).

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.ResourceExhausted
member.summary: Some resource has been exhausted, perhaps a per-user quota, or perhaps the entire file system is out of space.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.FailedPrecondition
member.summary: Operation was rejected because the system is not in a state required for the operation's execution. For example, directory to be deleted may be non-empty, an rmdir operation is applied to a non-directory, etc.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.Aborted
member.summary: The operation was aborted, typically due to a concurrency issue like sequencer check failures, transaction aborts, etc.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.OutOfRange
member.summary: Operation was attempted past the valid range. E.g., seeking or reading past end of file.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.Unimplemented
member.summary: Operation is not implemented or not supported/enabled in this service.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.Internal
member.summary: Internal errors. Means some invariants expected by underlying system has been broken. If you see one of these errors, something is very broken.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.Unavailable
member.summary: The service is currently unavailable. This is a most likely a transient condition and may be corrected by retrying with a backoff. Note that it is not always safe to retry non-idempotent operations.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.DataLoss
member.summary: Unrecoverable data loss or corruption.

member.name: F:NWorkQueue.Server.Common.ResultCode.Unauthenticated
member.summary: The request does not have valid authentication credentials for the operation.
